cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression (remnants – below SSHS hurricane strength)
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the east-central Gulf, then turning north toward the northern Gulf Coast (AL / FL Panhandle) Monday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast – likely the Florida Panhandle or Alabama coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Mississippi to the central Florida Panhandle; inland Southeast states after landfall
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (locally 4+ inches if feeder bands reach coastal GA Tuesday)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible Tuesday as remnants pass inland to the west
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of Georgia
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Tuesday–Wednesday could total 2–4 inches with isolated higher pockets
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain bands over southeast Georgia
